title: PRM-VAC-0005: Deterministic sorting + JSONL emission
description:
Implement deterministic record ordering and JSONL stream emission.

## Acceptance Criteria
- Records are sorted by (relative_path, root) lexicographic byte order before output.
- Stdout emits one JSON object per line (JSONL) with version=vacuum.v0.
- Multiple roots with same relative_path are disambiguated by root ordering deterministically.

## Notes
Boundary: emission contract only; record field construction in companion beads.

title: PRM-VAC-0002: Root validation + refusal envelopes
description:
Implement root validation and refusal envelope handling before scan start.

## Acceptance Criteria
- Empty roots, non-existent roots, unreadable roots trigger exit 2 with refusal envelope on stdout.
- Refusal codes implemented: E_ROOT_NOT_FOUND, E_ROOT_PERMISSION, E_IO with detail payloads matching plan.
- Multi-root validation is fail-fast on first invalid root.

## Notes
Boundary: root-level refusal behavior only; per-file skips are handled in separate bead.

title: PRM-VAC-0007: MIME mapping + path normalization
description:
Implement extension-based MIME guesser and path normalization helpers.

## Acceptance Criteria
- Built-in extension mapping covers minimum set in PLAN.md (csv/tsv/txt/json/jsonl/xml/pdf/xlsx/xls/parquet/zip/gz/yaml/yml).
- Unknown extensions map to null.
- relative_path always uses forward slashes; path/root remain OS-native.

## Notes
Boundary: heuristic mapping only; no magic-bytes detection in v0.1.

title: PRM-VAC-0008: Witness append + --no-witness
description:
Add ambient witness recording for scan/refusal runs with --no-witness bypass.

## Acceptance Criteria
- Successful and refusal runs append witness.v0 record by default.
- --no-witness suppresses writes without changing domain exit code.
- Ledger resolution follows EPISTEMIC_WITNESS then ~/.epistemic/witness.jsonl.

## Notes
Boundary: run-time witness append only; query CLI in follow-up bead.

title: PRM-VAC-0009: Witness query/last/count CLI
description:
Implement witness CLI subcommands query/last/count for vacuum.

## Acceptance Criteria
- vacuum witness query/last/count subcommands work with json and human output modes as documented.
- Filters (tool/since/until/outcome/input-hash/limit) operate correctly for query/count.
- Exit behavior for empty/no-match states is consistent with spine witness conventions.

## Notes
Depends on witness ledger implementation from PRM-VAC-0008.

title: PRM-VAC-0013: --schema output
description:
Implement --schema flag for JSON Schema output (deferred scope item).

## Acceptance Criteria
- --schema prints valid JSON Schema for vacuum.v0 record and exits 0 before root validation.
- Schema includes optional _skipped/_warnings fields and tool_versions object.
- Regression test validates schema JSON structure and required fields.

## Notes
Deferred scope; schedule after v0.1 must-have path is stable.

title: PRM-VAC-0012: v0.1 scanner test suite
description:
Implement v0.1 test suite covering scanner contracts, refusals, witness, and golden behavior.

## Acceptance Criteria
- Tests cover: basic scan, ordering, include/exclude, symlink mode, skipped records, MIME mapping, path normalization, refusals, exit codes, idempotency.
- Golden tests compare structurally while normalizing variable absolute-path/mtime fields.
- Witness tests cover append + no-witness + witness subcommands.

## Notes
Must pass under cargo test in CI; no network/external service dependency.

title: PRM-VAC-0014: --progress structured reporting
description:
Implement structured progress reporting to stderr via --progress (deferred scope item).

## Acceptance Criteria
- --progress emits JSONL progress records at configured cadence and immediate warning records for skipped files.
- Without --progress, stderr remains unstructured warning lines only.
- Tests validate progress payload structure and non-interference with stdout JSONL manifest.

## Notes
Deferred scope; performance tuning may follow initial correctness.

title: PRM-VAC-0004: Include/exclude glob filtering
description:
Implement include/exclude glob filtering against normalized relative_path.

## Acceptance Criteria
- Include patterns are OR-matched; exclude patterns override include matches.
- Matching uses forward-slash normalized relative_path on all platforms.
- Pattern behavior aligns with plan examples for *, **, ?, character classes.

## Notes
Boundary: filtering of leaf files only; directory traversal remains unconditional.

title: PRM-VAC-0015: Decide multi-root collision policy
description:
Resolve multi-root relative_path collision policy from open question in plan.

## Acceptance Criteria
- Decision recorded in docs/PLAN.md or a dedicated ADR with chosen policy and rationale.
- Downstream compatibility impact on lock/path identity is documented.
- If policy requires behavior change, follow-up implementation bead is created and linked.

## Notes
Decision bead only; do not silently change scanner output semantics without explicit decision.

title: PRM-VAC-0006: _skipped record contract
description:
Implement per-file failure handling as _skipped records with warnings.

## Acceptance Criteria
- Stat/read failures on individual files produce _skipped=true records (not refusal).
- Skipped records set size=null and mtime=null while preserving path/root/relative_path and extension/mime when derivable.
- _warnings includes tool/code/message/detail payload with E_IO-style detail.

## Notes
Non-goal: root-level scan refusal (handled by PRM-VAC-0002).

title: PRM-VAC-0010: operator.json + --describe
description:
Add operator manifest and --describe plumbing.

## Acceptance Criteria
- operator.json is embedded/served with schema_version/operator metadata from plan.
- --describe prints operator manifest and exits 0 before root validation.
- Manifest refusal/exit_code/pipeline blocks match documented semantics.

## Notes
Non-goal: schema JSON output and progress stream (separate deferred beads).

title: PRM-VAC-0001: Scaffold crate + CLI surface
description:
Build the Rust project scaffold and CLI entry surface per docs/PLAN.md execution flow.

## Acceptance Criteria
- Cargo crate has src/main.rs and src/lib.rs with run() -> u8 exit mapping.
- CLI supports positional ROOTS + subcommand shell for witness + flags: include/exclude/no-follow/no-witness/describe/schema/progress/version.
- Module layout created as documented (cli, walk, record, output, refusal, witness).

## Notes
Boundary: skeleton and argument plumbing only; no filesystem traversal logic in this bead.

title: PRM-VAC-0003: Recursive walker + symlink behavior
description:
Implement recursive directory traversal with walkdir and symlink behavior from plan.

## Acceptance Criteria
- Scans one or more roots recursively and collects file entries.
- Default follows symlinks; --no-follow disables symlink-directory traversal and uses link metadata semantics.
- Symlink cycles do not crash scan.

## Notes
Boundary: entry collection only; filtering/sorting/output in downstream beads.

title: PRM-VAC-0011: Build fixture corpus
description:
Build test fixture corpus for scanner behavior and edge handling.

## Acceptance Criteria
- tests/fixtures includes simple, nested, empty_dir, symlinks, and mixed directories.
- Fixture README documents intent and expected behaviors for each fixture set.
- Fixtures are stable for deterministic ordering and size assertions.

## Notes
This bead prepares data only; assertion logic lives in test-suite bead.
